values:
Look at my user icons!  I finally have a good set of Kohaku icons, two of them made by <lj user="yume_icons">!!  Aren't they fabulous?  ^^

*twirls in happy circles*  ^^!

His faxe is shaped like an oval with a broken nose stuck in the middle. Nevermind the spelling error . . . I'm picturing a nose stuck on with crazy glue . . . quite badly, so it's loose and dangling -- broken. His ears are covered by his slightly long golden brown hair. How does he hear? Sounds like it's growing from his ears, too . . . poor, hairy child. His eyes are empty, dark brown. GAH! HE HAS NO PUPILS! KILL IT!!! His height is some-what short.He looks pretty strong though. Just so you know, folks, you *can* be strong even if you're somewhat short. You may all be relieved now.

Rose:  When I said it was okay to do the network thing, I didn't think you were going to revive Noc *now* . . . more like later, when it was actually needed.  ^^;  In . . . a few months.

On other random notes not related to the above and just in general, apparently Kelsey re-contacted me and said that unicorns were real animals in the books, and would she be able to become an animagus at a later point?  (She was polite about it, at least.)

Dang it.  I want someone to app to be a slug.  Enough of the sparkly stuff.

Love, angst, drama, and pea soup!  . . . or maybe just cranberry juice.

For anyone who has ever hated Chibi Usa of Sailormoon fandom . . . go here:  http://www.adequate.com/ChibiProject/  :)

*coughs*  Oi.  Just . . . oi.

*hms and considers making an entry for tomorrow*  Shiranai.  ^^

Rped with Aya . . . I think I cheered her up a bit.  That pleases me.  Used Animaru . . . excellent.  Poor boy doesn't get much use.  *pets him*

Niiiiight, minna.

What Is Your Battle Cry?

Rampaging out of the freeway, carrying two hardened pitas, cometh Silvergryphon! And she gives a low bellow:

"I'm going to punch you to the moon and back, then bake cookies!!"

Find out!
Enter username:
Are you a girl, or a guy ?

created by beatings : powered by monkeys

. . . I am most terribly amused. XD Considering the number of pitas that we have around here, I could probably do it, too. XDDDD

K is updating her journal. Behold! Have a quiz.

You are pink. You are in limbo. Not pure and manipulated like white, not impure and noble like red. You are unsure of your real identity, but whatever you chose it to be, you can be it. That is your power. You change everyone you touch, and everyone remembers you. In literature, pink represents the place between heaven and hell. You are the one we will never forget.

What inner color are you?

That's pretty cool . . . If only it weren't so . . . pink. o.o *cough* Anyway. Called Naru yesterday and we had a conversation of great randomness. Very fun. ^^ I haven't called many people, so the experience was a little eerie for me (telephones and I are not a good combo because I get all self-conscious). And I so do not sound sixteen. >.< Curse you, Mary, for starting this idea. Don't want to go to psych class in a few minutes . . . bleah. Otherwise I have a fluffy sweater on and I'm quite content. ^^ Waaaaaaaarmth. *_* Vive le randomness! *darts off*

Good news:  My Inuyasha DVDs caaaaaaaaaaame!!!!!!!!!  :D!!!!!!

Bad news:  I got two copies of one DVD instead of the third I ordered.  :(

Doom to them.  >.>

. . . Today I found out that my recent buddy icon was perverted.  I thought it was cute . . . my mind never thinks of these other things.  I feel silly now.  ;_;  I changed it to something else; I hope it's better.

I lead a very sheltered life, I guess.  I don't seek that kind of humor out.  So if you see something of that nature . . . poke me.  Five to one I have no idea.

Papillion now has a Yume-chan!  ^^  She's taken both Alec and Tenjiro.  Wai wai!!  *twirls about*

And my journal now has both a background (courtesy of the esu-chan  ^^) and some new userpics.  :)  All of Yuuichirou.  Yes, I'm obsessed.  Shoo.  ;P  He's just a really cool character.  I'll dig up why I think so later, maybe.

Was able to get onto Scattergood last night via javascript.  Bleah.  I was reminded of how much I hate that thing . . . and how much I miss my client!  But at any rate I got some mails taken care of.  I'd do the same for Hogwarts, but yet again I have forgotten the website address.  >.>  It's never what's advertised, either.  Ah, well . . . just as well . . .  I can't rp on javascript; it frustrates me because it keeps erasing my poses.  And Xenos probably has some punishments to give out if I know the Slytherins.

Had a doctor's appointment yesterday.  Physical.  She poked me all over.  o.o  Says I'm in good health, though, so whee!  Poor woman . . . she had to deal with my excessively ticklish stomach.  :)

Dreamed about *really* strange things last night . . . turtles shooting through the air and the like.  I'm not sure I want to know what that means.

Well, enough randomness.  I'm off to write!  . . . Or something.  :)

The bad news is that my desktop computer has decided for the thirty-third time that it can no longer survive the world, has given me multiple blue screens of death, and has died.  I don't quite trust it to boot it up and work on it.  I suppose I'll try to get on in a bit and try to salvage some files, but pretty much I've given up on it, poor thing.

So what am I typing on, you ask?  A laptop!  :)  No, not a new one by any means.  But it connects to the internet, has Word, and is sufficient for my meager needs.  I only tend to need the Internet, AIM, and Word as of late.  I don't quite trust it with a MOO program yet, so I have to think about that, but at least I have something reasonably stable for the time being.  Dad says that Windows NT is supposed to be a pretty stable operating system.  It takes forever to boot up and to shut down, but I'm pretty happy with it.  :)  And as a completely random note, I love the sound the keyboard makes as I type.  Reminds me of rain dripping onto the roof.

Must decide how to wreak havoc today.  Yes.  I might try to finish the post for Papillion that I was working on.  It's sad, but I think it will turn out well.  No one wants to play Ryo, so this'll be my way of getting him out of the way.  Poor guy.  :)  Ah, well, he'll survive.  I can use him as a npc.

I probably should have done this in your comments box, Yume-chan, but I'll put this here whilst I'm thinking about it.  Available characters are as follows.  I'll warn you now that they're mostly guys.  If you don't feel comfortable playing a guy, let me know and we'll work something out.  Be honest if you're not comfortable.  ;P

-I have a few masurao that have no one to play them, and I can't handle myself.  (Currently I'm playing all of them except for one.  @_@)  Masurao are the bodyguards of the senshi, bonded to their duties and usually forming close relationships with their senshi.  See me if you want a bit of a better definition, but that's the basic part of it.  :)  Among the available:  Tenjiro (Uranus no masurao and the commander of the group), Alec (Venus no masurao), and Ryo (Mercury no masurao) -- who I won't get rid of if you want him.

-Some of the senshi on Sol's side don't have masurao either.  Those who don't are Hespera, Aurora, Nyx, and Nova, to my knowledge.  I don't *think* I've missed one?  o.o  So many names.  Gah.

-Umi has some senshi of her own creation that she's trying to handle by herself.  Correct me if I'm wrong, Umi-chan, and these aren't available . . .  Venus and Uranus?  See her if you're interested in them.  :)

And if you don't like any of these options, like I said, we can work something out, so feel free to ask.  :)

Let's see . . . not much else to offer the journal in the way of news.  Have a week left off.  Sigh.  Time goes too quickly.  I have yet to finish Escaflowne.  Seh-chan tried to tell me the end last night.  Or at least cackled about it.  Doom to you, Seh-chan.  >.>

I'd best be off to get cleaned up.  :)  Mata!

K is bored.  Very bored.  >.>  What does K do when she gets bored?  (Besides speak about herself in third person?)

She wreaks havoc on the lives of innocent civilians!  XD

. . . *cough*  Yes.  Either that or she makes a quiz/survey thing, rps odd plots, or tries to finish Escaflowne.

Don't tell me the end, darnit!  <.<  *shakes her fist*

Well, I've been looking back through this thing a bit.  A lot of depressed entries.  I don't like them.  I didn't like writing them in the first place.  I'd like to use this journal every now and then, but they sit there, mocking me, reminding me of a darker past.  Some advise me to erase them, but I can't . . . they're there.  They were a part of me, like it or not.  I won't be ashamed of them . . . but I will move on.

Starting with the layout.  I'm giving it an overhaul.  Hopefully I can get a picture up in the background to match the new colors, format, title, etc.  Hoping to dig up a couple new userpics.

I am Katherine.  Hear me roar.  I've finished an old chapter in my life . . . I'm ready to write a new one with a brighter outlook.

Those who think I'm being silly or other weird thoughts . . . deal with it.  I feel good.

Welcome Yume-chan and my esu-chan, Umi, to my friendslist.  :)

*yawns*  What's it been?  Three months?  Something like that.  Well, I said you probably wouldn't see anything in here for a while.  :P  I'm not quite up to Seh-chan's caliber yet, but I'm working on it, it seems.

Life goes well.  Tis a lazy Saturday morning . . . oops.  Wait.  Tis afternoon.  *cough*  I should probably take my shower.  I'm not sure what to say in here anyway.  :)  Out of practice, I suppose.  Mata!

I would just like to say . . .  WHOO!!  Yaaaaaata!!!!!  :D  *celebrates!*  :D

On another note, bai bai.  You probably won't see anything in here for a while.  :)

Feeling dark tonight . . . I hope it's just that time of month and nothing else.  Need to check the calendar.

Start working the eight hour days on Monday . . . oi . . .  I'm tired by the end of four.  This will be interesting.  Thanks, Yume, for the comment you made earlier.  It was sweet of you.  :)  Yeah, I'm sure it will get better . . . it's just trying to get there, eh?  ;)

I have a feeling that I'm causing actual friction between Ailyn and Fongus on the MOO of doom . . .  He was *not* pleased that I showed up last night, and blamed Ailyn, saying that she'd brought me there.  She hadn't . . . I had promised to meet her later.  Ailyn doesn't want me to feel daunted or anything because of him, but I don't like causing this friction either . . .  I guess she had told him that her character would probably end up with his, but strangely enough the character has developed a crush on my character Luc . . .  I'm not sure what to do about all this.

Meanwhile Monica currently outshines me teaching charms . . . she's had a class nearly every day!  How do people get so involved . . . ?

I kind of miss playing Saihyou these days.  Maybe I'll drop in soon.

First day of work . . . man, I'm tired. Made a few mistakes, but everyone seemed to be quite nice. I was showed around the building by a *very* vivacious woman named Rhonda, who never seemed to stop moving or even to move slowly in either movements or voice. On two separate occasions while she was explaining things to me people asked her if she was going to pause at some point and take a breath. lol!

The Final Fantasy Girl you relate witht the most!
brought to you by ka-chan

Today I woke up early (yes, again) to go see Star Wars (yes, again). :) Went with otousan, who introduced me to it in the first place. Great fun. We went to a different movie theater . . . It was nice. o.o The seats were very soft, it was clean, stadium seating (so we sat where we'd have no one in front of us), and a good view. Wai! Now all that remains is to drag Gold-chan to it. :) (Not that I think she'd terribly mind. :) )

Heading off to a play tonight. :)
What type of Bishounen are you? Find out at artificial-soul.net by Rin.

Wee! I took the Shounen or Shoujo test, created by Heh . . . Kind of knew I was somewhere in between. I like a mixture of both in my anime. What did I tell you? Water again . . .


Which Toe Are You?

Okay . . . I'm even disturbed I took this quiz.


Which Evangelion Child Are You?

Yet to see this . . . No throwing tomatoes, please. :P Tried to rent the Breakfast Club today. Unfortunately I found out that it was rated R and the stupid membership was set up before I was old enough to watch R movies. Thus the card does not permit me to check them out. This irritates me . . . bleah. Not worth losing sleep over, though. I'll get to it eventually. What really does irritate me is that I wasted money on The Musketeer (I'm not even going to *begin* on how bad that was) and Chocolat (I haven't seen it yet, but our neighbor already had the movie and was going to let us borrow it for free. --;). So that's about seven bucks gone . . . Movies are so expensive any more. Sent in my application earlier this week . . . now we wait more. Probably won't answer me and I'll be stuck in the exact same boat as last time. --; Must find out more info about the mafia in order to construct some evildoers for the MOO. I hope it's approved . . .

I saw Star Wars at 10:30 yesterday morning.  Not many people at the theater -- though we purposely picked a time when most people would be at work or in school.  :)  The result?  Not at all a hard time finding a seat.  The movie?  Great!!!!  If you haven't seen it/haven't been planning to see it, *go*!  Such a step up from Episode I that I can't even begin to describe . . .  Well, I'm not going to try to describe, because I don't want to ruin it for anyone.  Go and see it for yourself.  ;)

Also talked to Green-chan yesterday . . . WAI!!  It's been such a long time.  o.o  But we got all caught up, and the talk was fun.  We're thinking about going out for dinner sometime (hopefully when Gold-chan gets home) along with Blue-chan so we all can get caught up fully.  :)

Computer is giving me trouble again . . . weird thing.  Now it randomly decides it wants to shut down . . .  Hrm.

I am truly passionate. Find your soul type at kelly.moranweb.com.
You're excited about life and in touch with yourself and nature. Tell me, do I have this straight? Virtues: You appreciate humor like none other. Puns might even spark laughter in you (TEHY R FUNNI). You seek adventure and connection with your surroundings. You seek friends who will not only share laughs with you but actually form a deep bond of trust and empathy beneath the surface. You look for adventure and courage in people, and variation is necessary to keep you under control. You see yourself as multi-faceted, so you need people who can see you in your many lights. You're constantly trying to figure yourself out while analyzing the people around you. Silly, silly people. Aspirations: You can't decide what you want to be yet, but you know you want it to be adventures and interesting, with constant changes. You don't know what love will do for you yet, but it's competing with adventure for a place in your heart. An internal conflict has begun: can you be a successful worker, lover, and parent all at once? Quirks: Noise of any sort is irritating when you're in the mood. Smacking gum, loud chewing, humming- it's about as pleasing as bodily noises. You dislike emaciated people because of jealousy and just plain disgust. You're a procrastinator but a hard worker, too. Factors: You need constant attention and support. You're high-maintnence, but a great, reliable friend. Nature needs you and you need nature; it's helped thus far, so keep in touch with the outside world. Future: Who knows! You absolutely need constant change, so vacationing is surely in the cards. Will you settle down or not? Love will find you eventually, as it does to everyone. Will you choose the sweet home life or the rewarding busy-bee life? More later, perhaps . . .

*dances wildly*  Get to see Star Wars tomorrow!!  I don't care about what Aaron says; that going to see it during the day is "normal" and "not like a true fan."  He can be jerky about it if he likes.  I'm going to see it!  WAI!!!  ^^
Don't wait around for other people.  Make your own happinesses.

Dreamed this again last night.  I have a very odd recurring place in my dreams . . .  The dream itself differs, but always the place is the same, and my feelings about it never change.

The place is a cave, dark and deep.  For a little while I can see where I am going, but then I can see no longer.  I must find the way to the end in pitch blackness punctuated occasionally by spurts of daylight in the middle (though those are rare).  It is easy to get lost in this cave, as it twists and turns and contains directions that can lead me on the wrong path, and always there are these sounds -- growling, almost -- that make it seem like something is about to jump on me.

Two times I've found my way through this cave, but still it continues to reappear.  Always for some reason I'm needing to go through it.  I'm no longer wanting (not that I did in the first place, but I did) to grope my way through it.  If dreams have meaning, I'm wondering what this means . . .
Evidently there was a glitch in the previous eggs that won't allow them to hatch, so I had to re-adopt. :)
Added Seh-chan's journal to my list and adopted this: ^^ That's about all. You may go back to your lives now. :)

Was curious to see what Saihyou would be like as a D&D character. No, I don't know why I'm doing this when I should be reading. I Am A: Chaotic Neutral Elf Fighter Bard

Alignment:
Chaotic Neutral characters are unstable, and frequently insane. They believe in disorder first and foremost, and will thus strive for that disorder in everything they do. This means that they will do whatever seems 'fun' or 'novel' at any given time.

Race:
Elves are the eldest of all races, although they are generally a bit smaller than humans. They are generally well-cultured, artistic, easy-going, and because of their long lives, unconcerned with day-to-day activities that other races frequently concern themselves with. Elves are, effectively, immortal, although they can be killed. After a thousand years or so, they simply pass on to the next plane of existance.

Primary Class:
Fighters are the warriors. They use weapons to accomplish their goals. This isn't to say that they aren't intelligent, but that they do, in fact, believe that violence is frequently the answer.

Secondary Class:
Bards are the entertainers. They sing, dance, and play instruments to make other people happy, and, frequently, make money. They also tend to dabble in magic a bit.

Deity:
Fenmarel Mestarine is the Chaotic Neutral elven god of outcasts and isolation. He is also known as the Lone Wolf. His followers are outcasts (either by force or by choice) from elven society, and believe in being self-sufficient. Their preferred weapon is the dagger. Fenmarel Mestarine's symbol is a pair of elven eyes in the darkness.

Find out What D&D Character Are You?, courtesy ofNeppyMan (e-mail)

Eh . . . off to read.

Much news . . .  Hum.  I'll just put it in a random conglomeration and you can figure it out if you're reading this, how's that?  ;P

Big good news of the day . . . I got a 100 on my psych essay about the small children I had to go interview!!  Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaai!!  *grabs the nearest random person and dances*  :D

I've also been offered a job at a library near home for the summer.  I have to pass a drug test (O.o;) and a page test, but the lady said she wouldn't hire anyone else unless I didn't pass.  She doesn't think I'll have a problem.  I'm not too sure what the page test is . . .  I think it's putting Dewey decimals in order and such.  I can handle that, if that's what it is.

Trying the Hogwarts moo thing again.  Still surprised that someone missed me . . .  Ah, well.  Passed a reasonably good evening . . . some aspects of the place are pretty much the same though.  Heh.  Guess I couldn't expect that much.  Perhaps someday some people will figure out how to be nice.

Still working on Scattergood.  Describing rooms in buildings, planning feasts and such.  It's perhaps an odd thing, but I love it when I feel useful . . . when I can have a hand in my environment and someone cares about what I do . . .

I need more sleep, though . . .  I've been getting to bed too late and not getting up as well as I should in the mornings.  I'm feeling drowsy in my classes -- even the one whose lectures always just fly by . . .  Must get more sleep.

Tis all for now . . . if I think of other things, I can put them in later.  :)

I'm Legolas!
If something draws near, I can usually feel it

Which LOTR Character are you?

Did you know that Dickens was a rock star?  Neither did I.  But according to my English professor, he was.  Evidently he went to readings and all these people crowded in to see him.  Some of them even fainted while listening.  o.o;;  When a shipment of the magazine that his serials came out in Boston (he was one of the many writers who wrote in serials in those days), people crowded on the docks waiting for the boat.  o.o

Thank you, that was your random fact of the evening.  :)  And you thought we only analyzed literature in English class.  ;)

I was being considered for a wizard position on the Scattergood MOO thing, and I got it!  I found out tonight!  Waaaai!  :D  I kind of thought she'd end up with the other candidate, but she chose me.  :D  I'll be an ic wizard, and basically from what I understand, I'm supposed to help create/mentor, as well as take care of "common events," such as classes and feasts.  I have to try to keep people involved and not let everything grow too melodramatic.  o.o  Much to do . . . but I'm up to try!  :)

I also created a character on a Fushigi Yuugi rp.  His name is Saihyou, and he is (in his opinion unfortunately) Genbu Seishi Urumiya.  Much fun.  :)  I didn't get to be ic tonight, but it will come.  I'm interested to see how he'll work . . . I've made him rather arrogant and apathetic.

In real life news, I watched a marathon of Card Captor Sakura . . .  Cuteness overload.  @_@  But I got to see Yue!  :)  And today watched Saint Tail . . . more shoujo cuteness overload.  I guess I asked for it when I was wishing for some last week after Vampire Hunter D and the X movie, ne?

Spoke to my friend in Switzerland tonight over chat.  Fun.  :)  I'm very behind on my French, it seems . . .

Mental note to track down Green-chan and see how she's doing . . .

Happy Easter, minna-san!  :)

Blah . . . slept too late to make my first class. And interview/paper looms for tomorrow . . . Meanwhile:

Which HP Kid Are You?
(Somehow I anticipated this . . . *sweatdrops*)

"Someday we'll look back on this and plow into a parked car." - written by A on our message board.

I have no idea what this quote means, but for some reason I really like it.  I'm opening it to the masses (*cough*  Yeah, masses.) for interpretation.  :)

There is evidently a mouse loose in the room of a girl down the hall.  It's interesting the reactions this gets:

J:  *pounding down the hallway to where RA, Isis, and I are talking, eyes wide*  What am I supposed to do if there's a mouse in my room?

RA:  There's a *mouse* in your room?  I've never seen a mouse in a dorm before . . .

Isis:  *leaping up*  A mouse??  *runs down the hall toward J's room*  If you squish it, can I have it for my archaeology project??

Roommate:  *to me*  A mouse?!  What??!  Close the door, close the door!!!!!

lol!  :)  I don't know if they've caught the mouse yet.  I hope they catch it alive and put it outside . . .

So good to be back!  Green-chan and Blue-chan came up for the weekend and we went out to dinner.  Twas great!  :)  I haven't seen Blue-chan since last fall . . .  Went to a Greek restaurant, then out for frozen custard.  Pouring rain, but it didn't matter.  Good evening.  :)

Finally got my alt!  Unfortunately I missed the sorting because of dinner, but such is the way of things, I suppose.  Wouldn't have missed dinner for anything.  :)  We'll see if this alt makes matters any better . . .

Playing Xenos right now . . . wai!  :)  I feel better right now than I've felt in a very long time . . .

I Am A: True Neutral Elf Ranger Bard

Alignment:
True Neutral characters are very rare. They believe that balance is the most important thing, and will not side with any other force. They will do whatever is necessary to preserve that balance, even if it means switching allegiances suddenly.

Race:
Elves are the eldest of all races, although they are generally a bit smaller than humans. They are generally well-cultured, artistic, easy-going, and because of their long lives, unconcerned with day-to-day activities that other races frequently ccern themselves with. Elves are, effectively, immortal, although they can be killed. After a thousand years or so, they simply pass on to the next plane of existance.

Primary Class:
Rangers are the defenders of nature and the elements. They are in tune with the Earth, and work to keep it safe and healthy.

Secondary Class:
Bards are the entertainers. They sing, dance, and play instruments to make other people happy, and, frequently, make money. They also tend to dabble in magic a bit.

Find out What D&D Character Are You?, courtesy of NeppyMan!

Not bad . . . I think. o.o *has never played D&D in her life* :) Eh, back to Jane Eyre, I guess . . .
Behold . . . I'm joining the ranks of the egg owners. Now if it doesn't hatch and turn into a virus, things will all be good, ne? Heh . . . I'm so cynical today. :)

These are my top two results for this test . . . never played any of the games, so I don't know either character, but they seem okay. :)
Take the Final Fantasy X personality test here! by
Take the Final Fantasy X personality test here! by

Friday at last . . . and I survived my exam.  Yay!  It was a little eerie taking it, though.  It's very windy today, and the wind howled through some hole somewhere in the room.  It sounded like girls screaming.  Somewhat disturbing.

I feel like being wildly creative today . . .  I don't know why.  I want to write, to draw, to rp, something.  I wish I had a story idea . . . it's been so long since I've written.  I feel like I should be working on something.  Some kind of story should be driving me insane.  :)

Today I saw an anime called Princess Nine.  Odd title, but it was quality.  :)  And I don't even care for sports, really . . .  It was about a baseball team being formed at a Japanese girls' highschool -- the first team of its kind.  It got a little over-dramatic at times, but the characters were well-sketched, there was good tension in the plot, and the music was terrific.  And it wasn't just about baseball.  :)  I just saw the first DVD . . . hopefully I'll get to see more.

The rest of the week went better than Monday.  I was still very glad to get to Saturday, though.  Sleep is good.  :)  I don't seem to get enough during the week . . .

Somehow managed to set my alarm for half an hour later than usual . . . I made it to class, but it was a rush.  Didn't really have that much in the way of breakfast.  Cereal bar in hand, I dashed out the door, only to discover that it was raining and that mud runs deep.

Jury duty later . . . so far this day has not started out well.  Hope it ends better . . .

Saw some anime today . . . St. Tail.  It's a very cute magical girl anime.  Evidently the main character is ordained by a nun and by God to steal things for good cause (i.e. to help out others).  o.o  I'm not sure what I make of this . . .  But ah, well.  On a sideways random note, the hedgehog was really cute.  :)

Feeling better . . .  Several things off my mind . . .  Now I'm just tired.  :)  Eh . . .  I can deal with that.  Just waiting for someone to come back, then I'll probably get off.

Ravenclaws value intellect -- you like things which challenge your mind, whether it be math, art, history, or all of the above and more! You might be somewhat withdrawn, or your intellect might make you a bit mysterious to others.
Get Sorted!

About the same today.  Slept late, then dragged myself out of bed.  I'm starting to wonder if I was meant to hibernate . . .

Drove over and did some shopping.  Got a few things -- of course not what I was looking for.  :)  Ah, well.

I finished a little project I was working on . . . I don't know if I'm fully pleased with it.  I may have to redo a bit of it and retouch it here and there.  I hope it will work.

The cat has been stalking my lap tonight.  I'll be sitting here, typing, when all of a sudden I notice that she's about ready to spring on top of me.  Panic and chaos ensue.  *looks over at her cat*  She may look innocent right now, but hah.  I know what she's really thinking.  :)

*cough*  That was random . . .  :)  Well, other than those things, not much tonight . . . it's quiet.  I guess I'll go back to creating a character and trying to fix my selector . . .

Well, I've actually managed to top myself . . .  I slept until noon.  I have the feeling that I was awake (or at least conscious) beforehand -- however, I think I just closed my eyes and dropped off again.  Oi . . .  I think I need more sleep.
